alert.note: Alert for Brooks (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 12:48PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Deep South Texas, including the following county, Brooks. * WHEN...Until 130 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1247 PM CDT, emergency management reported heavy rain in the advisory area, with localized street flooding in Falfurrias. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Rain will be ending soon, but water continues to run off streets. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Falfurrias, Encino, Falfurrias Junior High School, Falfurrias Fire Station, Pleasant Park, La Colonia Park, Airport Road Addition, Hidalgo City Park, Cantu Addition, Brooks County Airport, Brooks County Detention Center and Flowella. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
